Subjects: liturgical texts; Virgin Mary; translations; dialogues, Virgin and Christ; songs
_description: A version of the Sequence ‘Stabat iuxta Christi crucem’ — in 6-line stanzas (aabccb)

BodDig86.First Lines:
Stond wel moder ounder rodeBihold þi child wiþ glade
                    mode…
BodDig86.Last Lines:
…I deye almest I falle to groundeSo serw ful deþ nes
                    never non

CamStJohn111.First Lines:
stand wel moder vnder rodebi halt þi child vyt glede
                    modebliþe moder mai þu bie…
CamStJohn111.Last Lines:
…bot i deie þu gost to hellei tholie det for þine
                    sake…
CamStJohn111.Note:
4 1/2 x 6, aabccb, imperfect at end; Latin equivalent text written above
                    the English line by line. Musical notation.
CamStJohn111.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 89-91.

BLHar2253.First Lines:
Stond wel moder vnder rodebyholt þy sone wiþ glade
                    mode…
BLHar2253.Last Lines:
…þat þou sheddest on þe rodeþou bryng vs
                    in to heuene lyht

TCD301.First Lines:
[S]tand wel moder under rodebi halt þi sonne with glade
                    mode…
TCD301.Last Lines:
…Þat thu bledes hone þe rodethu do ws in tho heuene
                    riche
